Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One amazing lonely meatball

AG-la1tZJbsRUi6A81lQew.text: Great food and service. The complementary starters are delish... the pasta that was recommended was yummy. One thing I should of followed on the advice given in other reviews is to ask the 'Market Price' of the items. We split... thank goodness but turned out our steak was $130 . Other then that... all was delicious. And they end the night with a little limoncello.

bKjA5dWNcqpdjc3NQdJS_Q.text: Exceptional service and consistently top notch dishes from NYC to Vegas- this spot is a fun twist on the NY vibe, a hidden gem amongst the hustle and bustle of LV. Always professional and accommodating, a lost art in the restaurant biz today. Many thanks!

3my1pjKEuNoq6gpVjdd9ag.text: Carbone is like a set piece stuck in the Goodfellas universe and I'm not mad about it.    My fiance and I had reservations for 9pm on a Friday, we got there early and sat at the bar. They have a great bar space with an amazing cocktail menu and great selection of wines and whiskies. After ordering drinks and a snack-a-tizer, we were informed that our table was ready early, nice!   Just a heads up, before you order an appetizer wait until the pepperoni and bread plates arrive and then decide if more snacking foods will be in your future, because these plates of meats and cheeses are so delicious will take every ounce of your "goomba" willpower not to eat it all. We didn't know this and ordered an appetizer at the bar which, when placed on the table along with the pepperoni and breads, makes it look like a commercial to hype up foodie tourism to Sicily or South Jersey.    We went with the "Prosciutto and Mozz" to start and it was incredible, the mozzarella comes out hot and is cut with scissors right in front front of you, truly old school. You get three types of prosciutto, and they are all great. Salty, spicy, paper thin and not too greasy.   After the orgy of spiced cured meats, breads, and cheese came to an end it was finally time to eat dinner. My fiance and I split our meals, first up was the Tortellini Ragu, handmade pasta stuffed with ricotta and swimming in a rich Bolognese sauce. I personally loved the tortellini, but my fiance wasn't a fan, it was cooked perfect just past the point of being under so the pasta was still firm with small snap and the Bolognese "fugget about it" If could, I would have asked for a glass of the stuff to sip on afterwards.   Next up was the Veal Marsala, which we also shared; they brought it fully carved tongs in tow, so we could just serve ourselves. This was like butta, tender, juicy and with only a slim hint of guilt as I indulged in this tasty meal. The mushrooms, fantastic, the marsala sauce, again it was drinkable.   Throughout the entire night, the service was on point and the timing between meals was almost mechanical, it was just that good. No egg noodles and ketchup here, just pure New York Italian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IJlJEXczRplRfFnAnI58fA.text: Dont expect the same service and quality as the NY location. For those who have NOT been to Carbone NY, and may not have the opportunity to,  I would only recommend you pop to try their famous spicy rigatoni (not worth trying anything else here to be honest).   For those that have been, totally skip it - don't let this place taint the standard of the original because those expectations will not be met.  Our food that night was cold, the oysters were warm and our waitress was condescending and uncomfortably pushy.

GPmkaOWGCZfU6EgV6x3a1A.text: We went to Carbone with a group of 8 for a birthday dinner before heading to a concert. The service was incredible - our server guided us through the menu, recommended splitting a bunch of dishes (and even split the bowls of pasta into equal portions for us all to try at no extra charge), and tended to our needs without being overbearing. The food, as always, was incredible. We ordered the tableside caesar salad (so garlicky and delicious - the croutons are insane!), then split 4 portions of the Spicy Rigatoni Vodka between the 8 of us, and the Chicken Massimo (which was chicken in a balsamic glaze) with a side of grilled asparagus. They bring out complimentary meats, cheese, and an amazing bread basket in the beginning of the meal, and traditional italian rainbow cookies and Limoncello at the end of the meal - also complimentary. I love Carbone and can't wait to go back.

z5fd9Dlw9yUMX1NQO3CDAA.text: It has been awhile since we ate here, and I have yet to make a decision on if I would be willing to come back. The food was delicious, the service from the busser was impeccable, our server was our biggest issue. He was very pushy on selling us the nights specials, as well as getting our drink orders right when we got there. We told him we needed a minute to look over the menu, and by the time he came back to order he took the cocktail menu from us.   Personally, I pair my drinks with what I am going to eat to compliment each other (how strange). I think he had in his mind we weren't going to buy drinks so he just stopped checking on us all together. Literally! We were constantly checking with other servers for assistance. After over two hours of being there, we waited..and waited... for the check that never came. To the point where we were walking to the front of the doors to pay there, and they were telling us have a good night.. No... we are trying to pay for our bill, and we have waited almost forty minutes.. we just wanted us to pay to leave and they insisted on us sitting back at our table..  The manager I believe stopped by? She apologized, and a different server came and gave us a drink from the bar on the house.. It was like a lemon vodka, that was too strong.. and I am not sure if he meant to but he left the whole bottle on the table with us. Not my idea of fixing the issue, but that's just me, since we just wanted the check to leave. We didn't even finish the drinks that were poured or the bottle. It was just a strange experience, that I didn't expect especially based off of everyone's reviews. I was let down mostly because it was our date night and and we don't always get to spend time together and this is where we chose to spend it.

AtPtRfv5GiewBniOpKynYA.text: Food was very good. The renowned rigatoni wasn't life changing, as some reviewers mentioned, but it was still solid. I actually liked the linguine with clams better. Garlicky and flavorful. Caesar salad was nice and peppery, if a bit overdressed; bread was decent. Skip the sides. Minus one star for the friendly but very slow service - a salad and two pasta dishes took over two hours from start to finish - and for the prices. $30-35 seems a bit steep, even for this New Yorker!

Ukp4gJi_ZwNwbpOdF6cI0Q.text: This one of the best Italian restaurants in town. The wine was tasteful. They have the 3rd largest rum collection in the United States. The waiter were delightful and also helpful when I had a question. They have great antipasti. My table of seven shared the octopus, caprese salad, and rigatoni. The octopus was delicious and the caprese was some of the best I had. The rigatoni was stunning it was so good. As we went on to are entree's I was already amazed by the food. Even though being in an Italian restaurant I decided to order the Prime Porterhouse which I shared with a friend. It was great the filet Migmin was extremely flavorful and the NY strip was even better. I tried some lobster which was seasoned. I was not a fan but the rest of my table disagreed. The desserts were tasteful and I enjoyed them. Overall this restaurant was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu

eByDmqAytglAeUWuWWB9MQ.text: Restaurants and tastes and service are subjective but I must say I was really looking forward to eating at Carbone and I had an exceptional experience here.  The NYC West Village location has been on my radar for a bit and I've missed it the last two times I was in NYC. I was on a solo work trip to Vegas and figured hey, why not? I walked in just after 5 and asked if they had room for 1 with no reservation and they sat me two minutes later.  The dining room is pretty swanky. Huge chandelier, low lighting, burgundy velvet covered booths, waiters walking around in burgundy tuxedos, some private dimly lit booths, tall gold banquettes for privacy, crisp white tablecloths, etc. I'm not sure if it's old New York or old Las Vegas but it works! They brought the bread service while I was looking over the menu.  A plate of salami, a dish of pickled cauliflower with red onions, and the bread which was plain bread, a slice of tomato focaccia, and a slice of cheese garlic bread.  Best bites here were the acidic red onions in the cauliflower, the garlic bread which I could have eaten a whole loaf of and the tomato focaccia.  The focaccia tasted like it had been finished with fleur de sel and the little touch of salt with the fresh bread and tomato was perfection.  I started with the Insalata di mare.  This was a very delicately dressed seafood salad inside red leaf lettuce.  There was shrimp, scallops, calamari, etc.  This was light and excellent.  My one complaint of the evening was I believe the scallops should have been washed more thoroughly.  There was the slightest bit of grit.  For dinner I chose the Spicy Rigatoni, which is what Carbone is known for.  If you read my reviews regularly you know I'm always game for Vodka sauce! This was really delicious. Perfectly cooked pasta and a tangy creamy sauce.  For me it could have been spicier but it was really nicely done.  The waiter brought over the dessert cart which I would have loved to order from but I was too full.  The complimentary rainbow cookies after the meal were the perfect little treat though.  The service was impeccable and, for me, Carbone hit it out of the park.  One of the best meals I've had in 2019.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow Cookies
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Rigatoni
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Insalata di mare

54hXjy7g8gJJDjFAuCsV7A.text: So frustrated with this place I had to leave a review. In the last 2 years we have came 4 times. Each time we've tried to sit at the bar and each time they tell us the bar is reserved this night. They must reserve the bar every night, so DO NOT come here if you're trying to just pop in to the bar. The bar is reserved seating for parties only. Disappointed,  but time to give up.   Bardot directly across is very accommodating and good food. Skip Carbobe, go for Bardot.

_zFjS7KHrcLkm8SBwAgCJw.text: This was a solid Italian resto! The ambiance was great.  We were in a nice booth with comfy seats. We had the delish meatball and the fish. The bread was yummy. A nice respite from the flashy Vegas!

fcad2KRl6pGtgQxIQDXP9Q.text: Fantastic Italian food and great service! I came here one night and I was surprised to see that the bar was open and had seats, so I sat right down without any wait. Let me just say that the bartender (I forget his name) was amazing. He knew the menu well and guided me towards some fantastic food. In addition, he made me a great Manhatten, probably one of the best I've ever had.   The food was simply amazing. I really love Italian food because with simple quality ingredients you can really make the dish taste absolutely to die for. Everything was cooked well and I really loved that they gave you bread and parmesan cheese before any other food comes out. It's a great way to get a taste for the food here and to stave off any hunger.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P2qL4AwkEXmla1VSSc2Imw.text: Great food here. I had the best Caprese salad and scallop of my life.  The specialty - the creamy vodka pasta - was pretty gd as well  Easily the best free break basket I have ever been on the receiving end of. Deff recommend, but come with people you are close with. They serve family-style so it is good to have a dining companion that also enjoys sharing.

Kw9D3QbBE6oNsCsnf6tDuA.text: This place was good but I probably won't come back. The person bring out our food was great! Our waiter was a little strange. It was like he was avoiding us for some reason and not sure why. The garlic bread. Omg the garlic bread. I could probably eat a whole basket of just that.   I came here looking forward to the pasta with vodka sauce. It was alright. I think I had way high expectations.  Clams - yummmmm!   Scallops - I'm not a fan of scallops and my husband thought they were okay and nothing special.  We had the banana ice cream flambe thing. I really just got it for the experience. Lol.  Nice ambience. Expensive food for what it is. We'd probably go to other places instead the next time we are in Vegas.

ENjUGQT84ocGpRNZNoNzKw.text: Carbone is absolutely perfect. Everyone that works there is the utmost professional--friendly, appropriately attentive, hospital, and most of all NOT judgmental (I look really young for my age and tend to not get the best service at fine dining). I don't often tip more than 20% but it felt necessary here.  The food is exactly my type too. "Fine dining" in the sense that the ingredients are of the highest quality and the composition is sophisticated, but warm and comforting in presentation (feels more like a family dinner). The best example of this is the Caesar salad--a dish that you cant possibly imagine as special but somehow, someway they make it special and unforgettable.  The spicy rigatoni is also to die for--their specialty pasta is just delectable. Really can't go wrong with anything here!  Would love to come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

ttprZrzuPQNioDUv01xgcQ.text: Wow. What a fantastic meal. We sat down and were in a rush for a flight and the staff could not have been more accommodating.   Part 1: the bread...fantastic. The garlic bread is not overly garlic and perfectly crunchy. The tomato bread is also fantastic. The wine was also reasonably priced and very solid.   Part 2: for a starter we ordered the prosciutto with mozzarella and the Caesar salad. The prosciutto dish was solid. Above average but not spectacular. The Caesar on the other hand was out of this world. Whole lettuce leaves perfectly dressed with dressing and homemade croutons that are somehow soft and crunchy at the same time. Truly a work of art.   Part 3: for the main course we split the veal parmigiana, spicy rigatoni and the meatballs. Everything was fantastic, but the star of the show was definitely the spicy rigatoni. It was creamy but not too creamy. Spicy but not too spicy. A perfect dish anyway you slice it!  Would definitely recommend making Carbone at the Aria a part of any trip to Las Vegas. Better than the one in New York I dare say...

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Rigatoni

HXUMQXTQXBDzww_sjeHxcA.text: Just like the Carbone in NYC but much bigger and in a hotel. Look, menu, and recipes are the same but vibe is different. Hard to recreate the nyc location in Vegas, but this was still great in a different way. Felt more commercialized but food was definitely still great  Went with a bottle of an antinori badia a passignano, which isn't always easy to find on a restaurant menu. My group split a Caesar salad and tuna carpaccio special to start. Caesar was made table side and the tuna was phenomenal with a eggplant mousse. Next course was a meatball each with spicy rigatoni. Spicy rigatoni is an absolute must and the meatball complemented it well! For an entree, we split the pork chop (no bone) with roasted peppers and duck fat potatoes.....both were just WOW! Fantastic meal and great service. Couldn't have asked for more!

P6zSrJ1Rxi37qclzIsmlSA.text: Such a great food, service, and decoration. Loved it and definitely will come back!  The wine list is amazing!! And ribeye is delicious!!

LDmUweI8RUc5udC3X1hjBA.text: The food was delicious. We had the spicy rigatoni - which was my absolute favorite. We also had the FETTUCCINE CON FUNGHI (a little bland compared to the rigatoni) and the special fish of the night which was served with 3 sauces for you to choice.   The reason for the 3 stars was the service. The service started out excellent but when a larger party came in our server left us waiting over 30 minutes before he even came over to start our  desert table side and never once apologized for keeping us waiting. We ended up not getting the desert and leaving. For a place like this I expect a little more when it come to service.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5FzV0qrJBAbBtpmLA4Rwqw.text: For most cities this would be a 4 or 5 star review but the bar is higher in Las Vegas. The restaurant is dimly lit but not in a cozy way. The place echos so it was louder than I expected. The service was very good, our waiter helped us pick a good wine. He also encouraged us to order several courses and wasn't too disappointed when we only ordered 2 (plus a dessert later on).   The tomatoes and mozzarella was very good but not exceptional.  The spicy rigatoni was awesome but rich (I was glad I didn't have another course coming). The tiramisu was also very good but not exceptional.

IC1w6vRg1Odu2Y_ayVbZ8g.text: From the complimentary bread to the entrees, I was fully satisfied with every dish. There were 3 kinds of bread and I disliked the sesame crunchy bread(not sure why it's crunchy). It's great to be given complimentary garlic bread and tomato/pizza like bread. Those were good. They also give you chunks of cheese(if they don't give it to you, ask for it. Do it). They also give you complimentary salami(love) and the pickled cauliflower which I also love.   I would say their CARPACCIO PIEMONTESE* was definitely one of the best I've had. It's seasoned so well and although it's super thinly sliced(capraccio style), the little mushroom and truffle would gives you that punch of flavor + it's really good beef. Definitely recommend everybody to get this.  Spicy Rigatoni Vodka - it sounds so plain and there's not even any proteins so why listen to your waiter when they say that this is one of their dishes they're known for. Get it and find out because although it's just sauce, pasta, and cheese, it's SUPER delicious. Honestly, even the presentation looks super simply and meh but when you taste it, it's just so damn good. Idk how they do it but there's enough sauce and cheese for each rigatoni. You know how you usually order a pasta and even if you mix it, some part of it just doesn't seem to have the right amount of sauce and cheese but yea it's portion perfectly well. Really idk how I can describe it to you to make you get this dish but it's damn delicious.  Lobster Ravioli - Even though , if I had to switch up a dish it would be this lobster ravioli but it was still very good. The sauce is amazing and what's not to love about having lobster chunks outside the ravioli AND INSIDE of  the ravioli. The aroma coming from this dish makes you drool.   Veal Marsala - if you're not a veal fan, you should consider giving it a try here. Their marsala sauce is a litter more sweeter and richer than your typical marsala sauce. I've come up with theory that they prob use better wine for this sauce but that's just my opinion. This is one of the things theyre known for and rightfully so. The meat was tender and the sauce is a great pairing. I usually don't go devour a bone like that but I admit, there was no trace of meat left after.  POTATOES LOUIE - Like damn, duck fat with potato. The duck fat oil's aroma is so drooling, it drives me crazy. For a side dish to pair with your entrees, it seriously was surprising by how much potatoes there were. I would say it's the weakest dish, but I never had any potato style dish like this. It's the weakest dish but it's just a side and I thought it was kinda bang for the buck. It helped me get full and i've heard of mash potatoes, potato puree, potato scallop but never have I ever had this. By weakest dish and so, I've loved every single dish in their own way.  Service was great. I would definitely come back. A perfect combination of having Bardot for brunch and Carbone for dinner is probably one of the best thing you can imagine.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HR8SvnAe41pz4t2aOMrTgg.text: Was so excited to try this place since I never made it to go to the location in NYC. Has a modern twist to an old school Italian restaurant. All the servers and hosts are dressed sharply and very attentive.  Started off with a bottle of wine. They have an array of wine options by the glass, half bottle, or bottle. They start you off with some cheese and a basket of bread. There are three different types of bread that are amazingly delicious. The they offer you complimentary slant and pickled cauliflower.  For dinner, we got a chopped salad which was so yummy and light. We also got the rigatoni which is a must!!! For my main dish I got the cauliflower steak which was okay. I probably wouldn't order it again.  All in all it was a great experience and fantastic food. Looking forward to coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni

4n6GqobN5bRikQOop8w_Nw.text: Had reservations but came early to have a drink at the bar - - but all seats at the bar blocked / reserved for those ordering dinner.  We did get our table right on time, even though we were not seated in the main dining room and the noise level was unpleasant.  Extensive wine list by the bottle, not so much by the glass.  Limited cocktail choices, but huge selection of rums. Service was slow to start, but improved.  The lobster cocktail was excellent !  We ordered the spicy rigatoni along with the veal parm. The manager did come by and check on us.  My wife had been here several times before and always enjoys the restaurant. The service finished in excellent manner and we were pleased in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TG38PTqxgdFOfE4bozvK1Q.text: I love this place !!! They always have that rigatoni that i love the most and the cookies and lemon cello at the end that make me feel loved!!!!

ZvSskgWjEmlUlLs3KcvwdQ.text: New favorite restaurant in Vegas! I had the pleasure of dining at Carbone last night and was blown away by the service, atmosphere, food and wine list. I was lucky enough to be dining with a Carbone veteran so he did the ordering for the table.   Started with the complimentary Parmesan, salami and bread basket with pizza bread and garlic bread. Worth every carb and calorie. The waitress also brought out the huge nuggets of white truffle for us to view, which I will be dreaming about. We started with the delicious beet salad and grilled octopus. Not the best I've ever had or the stars of the show, but very good. Then we had the baked clams, wow! Such great flavors, not too much panko, big meaty clams, a bit of lemon.  Second course was my favorite, the pasta. We each had the legendary spicy rigatoni vodka and split the lobster ravioli for the table. That spicy rigatoni might be my favorite pasta dish ever. The pasta is so perfectly cooked but also melts in your mouth. The sauce clings to the pasta like you wouldn't believe. It's magical. Lobster ravioli was also 5/5, huge pieces of lobster with great flavors.  Then we had the grilled prawns, sirloin, veal Parmesan and potatoes in duck fat. Ah! Everything was out of this world. Standouts in that course were veal Parmesan and the potatoes. Last but not least, we finished with bananas foster, the best cheesecake I've had outside of New York and excellent carrot cake. Needless to say, I'm still full from this dinner.  The atmosphere and service deserve 5 stars as well, because it was one of those moments where you look around and say this is how dining out should be. Thank you Carbone, I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great atmosphere at Carbone
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They brought out the white truffles for us to ogle!
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sirloin steak

6zhIt7La3Bf-73NFRt91yQ.text: One of the best Vegas restaurants I've been to. Not cheap, but amazing food and impeccable service. Love the family style dining. Octopus app was killer. As were the lamb chops. And pretty much everything else. Three best desserts were the carrot cake (very unique, even relative to what you see when they show you the dessert spread), the cheese cake (lemony and very creamy), and chocolate cherry cake (and I'm not a cake person, but it had layers of mouse--and ice cream).

gpkAEwZgHQo_EGXbNnSmDQ.text: This place was recommended by a friend and after reading some of the reviews on the customer service I was a little skeptical.  Here is what I think:  Portions are okay in size but taste is amazing! The atmosphere of the place is perfect. The lighting is darker so it feels more intimate, it really gives a great tone for the establishment. Like I stated earlier, I noticed other reviews mentioned problems with staff, but I had no issues at all and thoroughly enjoyed my dinner here with my husband. Overall a great place for a date night, anniversary, or even a birthday party.   Try the rigatoni!!!!

4klviWbzAvHrRlKg6SsajQ.text: The food was good, but ... the experience was loathsome ... and kind of sad. I think this place was designed for men in their 20s who just don't know any better. I mean, it's supposed to recreate 1958, but we were seated under a speaker blaring mid-1960s pop music. That was our first clue that something's just ... off about this place.   Here are some other highlights:  The "captain" said he'd tell us the price of the specials, but only if we were interested in ordering them. Very classy.   He repeatedly described small portions as "designed for sharing". (And why would a plate of rigatoni be a signature dish? Everybody's nonna brings a tray of rigatoni to pot lucks and picnics. Nothing special about Carbone's rigatoni that would differentiate it from nonna's. Except the price, obviously.)  The wines were priced a little higher higher than any other Vegas restaurant.   The restaurant drops a lot of complimentary snacks on the table while you wait. It's not a ... bad thing, but everything is heavy and spicy, while some of the main courses are delicately flavored and are overpowered by the pizza bread and salami and chunks of cheese and pickled cauliflower.   The "captain" didn't offer us any limoncello, either, but he probably figured we wanted to get out of there and would stiff him on the tip. We did NOT, as this mess of a place is not entirely his fault.   The food was way overpriced. Similar dishes at other high-end Italian restaurants -- with less-muddled concepts -- are less expensive, and the experiences have never made me want to get up and leave.

MWzo8qYJ8AkFkMo2dC5_Vw.text: Mediocre at best. Loud atmosphere, overrated food, and small portions. Service was not good, my water glass was empty for half the night. So many other options...skip this one.

aBWAOw9WvW15y0UDtbQdsA.text: Really disappointed with this restaurant . first the restaurant is freezing !!!!!! Then the food is really mediocre . We order the New York stake and the veal Marsala and it was really average . Not what you expect from a top Italian restaurant . Server was really good and helpful. But that will be my only dinner . I will pass from now on

ynNtYIuzPexSuBvsHMSa2w.text: Loved loved loved this place. We didn't have reservations but were able to get a seat at the bar. The service was great and the food was definitely memorable. The decor was old school Italian Godfather-ish. We tried a few items and all of them were great. Will definitely be back!

6omPzVbNXNS6P3Jbz8KQZQ.text: Carbone is not only my favorite italian restaurant, but possibly my overall favorite restaurant. I've been to Carbone NYC once and this location a number of times. The food is absolutely outstanding. Service is impeccable. Presentation on point. And did I mention the food? The Spicy Rigatoni Vodka is the best pasta dish i've ever had and I struggle to recall a Caesar salad to rival Carbone's. If Bernie is at the Bar, you will be well taken care of. And if you can find room, get the banana flambe. You are welcome.

u4JJ2iEG1APQ-SjGIjf9uw.text: This was probably the best meal that was actually worth the bill in Vegas.it was unfortunate that we had to rush through dinner due to having to make it on time for a show. We were served the most delicious bread basket while we made our selections. We ordered the octopus appetizer. I was skeptical but my husband wanted to try it. The octopus was delicious!!!! I asked for a second bread basket and it was brought out quickly. We shared the ribeye Diana and the spicy rigatoni vodka. It was so good!!!!! The ribeye was very flavorful and very italian-y in spices. The pasta was so good. My husband and I are not very big people so I do believe we ordered too much food. It broke my heart to leave half the ribeye on the plate as we had 1. No more room in our stomachs and 2. Had to leave to catch the show on time. Next time, we will probably order 2 appetizers and 2 pastas. That would be the perfect amount of food. Danny and Eric were great waiters!

a7Qd2gy6FkZU4Dl0sgqqxw.text: For a place that prides itself on service, it's pretty embarrassing how bad theirs is.  Not worth the $ - would rather have a Somalian pirate than their captain.

83nhldByY_h_OqgzFek9aQ.text: Captain.... What Captain??  I went to Carbone on a Saturday night around 830. We had a reservation. It was busy but not too crazy. Waited about 15 minutes then our party of 11 was sat.  Then we waited for another 10 minutes and a server assistant came by for the drink order. We all order cocktails as we we're celebrating a birthday. The drinks took about 15 minutes to come to the table. We have been there 30 minutes and NO CAPTAIN yet. Finally here he comes... He starts telling us the specials and most of the 11 could not understand / hear him. Then he starts taking orders. After several questions and people ordering he is gone.  I ordered veal Parmesan and my wife ordered branzino. The captain says he's not sure if they have it and has to go ask. He disappeared for 5 minutes and returned. No problem we can order branzino. One of our guests never got to order his meal. Then we wait. We all were ready for more drinks... Nothing... Waited some more. We asked for bread several times. No bread. About 20 min later the apps arrive. Our guest that didn't order placed his order at this time. Food was delicious. And we could order our second cocktails. STILL NO BREAD.  Then captain returns to tell one of the guests they DID NOT HAVE LOBSTER MAC AND CHEESE.  So he orders something else. About 20 more minutes go by and we still have NO BREAD. The captain returns to tell my wife they have NO BRANZINO.  At this point we are very upset. We asked to talk to the manager. She came by apologized and said she would bring bread right out. We have now been there for about an hour and a half. I noticed another table of 5 that sat down right as we did is paying the check. They already had dessert. By now the restaurant is clearing out. It is after 10:20. We did not get entrees for another 20 minutes and they FORGOT ALL OF THE SIDES WE HAD ORDERED. This review is getting long so I'll wrap it up. DINNER TOOK OVER 3 HOURS. Service was the worst we've had EVER!!  CHECK WAS $955 after they comped off a bunch of drinks , free desserts , and comped some food.  STILL FELT LIKE IT WAS A WASTE OF MONEY. I WILL NOT RETURN. NONE OF IS WILL. THIS WAS A TABLE FULL OF BUSINESS REPS WHO WILL NOT RETURN. Who would subject their clientele to this. One star because zero is not an option.

5JyDHjGR9vfIw_p2bMfLkQ.text: If I could eat here every day of my life, I would.  It really is that good.  I have been here a few times and every time it lives up to the hype.  So, so, so good!!!!!!!!  I love the mai tais and spicy rigatoni.  The bartenders and service are amazing.  It really is my favorite place in Las Vegas.  Soon good!

tl2DVgYaFWOpug6B-7uPUw.text: This is a really fun and enjoyable meal, it reminded us of going to a NYC Italian style steakhouse with food prepped table side. The staff, decor, and ambiance lend greatly to the overall dining experience and the food was also very pleasing. Is it the best Italian food in Las Vegas, no, but it's a quality and very enjoyable meal that is unique to all those other restaurants.

B7cX5vIT0HjfRfTRMHLbJA.text: 2nd time was last Saturday.  Love this place. Fois Gras Veneziana . Beets Siciliana, Caprese, veal marsala , spicy rigatoni vodka, lobster ravioli, double lamb chops, dover piccata .... All Perfecto ! Ask for Sal for your waiter and the manager Jo   They made our dinner even more special

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bass Oreganata
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angel Hair Aop
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras Veneziana

Mqdwt1MYtzt6Rrx2RYw3mw.text: Amazing! Best caesar salad I have ever had! Spicy rigatolle pasta and meatball appetizer were yummy. Lobster entree was to die for!

ICnYhq5RHciYSrsmd2QTgg.text: I have looked forward to popping into Carbone for quite some time and as avid travelers to Italy, I brought friends and family here as a treat. The atmosphere and presentations were warm and cozy. The food was average and my review is largely based on the conceited service that Carbone apparently upholds. The cherry pepper ribs have a wonderful flavor though the ribs themselves are incredibly tough.  I ordered a pasta dish for my parents and requested it to be well done rather than al dente as they have difficulty chewing and was told by the server that he will not offend the chef by making such a request.  We have spent countless months traveling the villages and cities of Italy and always requested softer well done pasta for my parents to be able to enjoy. Clearly Carbone is well off enough to refuse to serve patrons in an accommodating fashion. The tourists may keep this place going.  As a local, I will not dine here again. Shameful.

xtTah0swumBH2z9ZuJH2-Q.text: Worst dinner I've ever had, the only good part was the bread. The minestrone soup made everyone at the table gag, the squid ink pasta was bad, the vodka pasta was nothing special. This place is NOT worth the price please don't go here!!

tOCd0nOEJ3OWW2NX8NRvPA.text: Ate dinner at the bar. Kurk was a great bartender/host. They have this pickled cauliflower dish with sliced spicy ham that accompanied the fantastic bread which is worth coming back for alone. I had their meatballs with linguine. I requested tomato sauce that was extra spicy and they came through. I'll definitely be back.

8jXl3di2M6_H2khFCfLz2A.text: One of the best meals I've ever had!! Eat here if you get the chance. I had the angel hair and meatballs, truly delish!  I also ate the chopped salad and the prosciutto as well as the lemon cheesecake. Honestly loved it all. The service was phenomenal. I will come back the first chance I get. Thank you Louie Carbone!!!!!

ZLBUELGwTDvmLJ9U9ARPZg.text: This place is absolutely AMAZING! The restaurant is so beautiful and definitely has a cool New York vibe! I also really enjoyed the music they were playing, great soundtrack! For dinner we had the spicy vodka rigatoni, the veal parmesan, and the potatoes soaked in duck fat! All were delicious! I had the White Lady cocktail and it was so good! Eric was our captain and was so nice and very helpful when it came to picking out items from the menu! His assistant Ian or Ivan, I forget his name, was great as well! I will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone seeking great italian cuisine on the Las Vegas strip!

7Drf_m9xlWg5VFNS1Se2Zw.text: The place is just bad all around. I think the food would have tasted much better if the service was quicker. We made a reservation for 6 we got there on time and sat down but from there it was all down hill. First the food took over an hour to show up at our table, the restaurant was not even 3/4 full so how could it take so long for the food to come out! We wanted to order wine so my brother was talking to the Sommelier and they just kept steering him towards the most expensive wine on the menu. Come on people just because we are not wine experts does not mean we do not know about wine! when the food arrived the waiter served one serving of lasagna  and walked away. what about the rest of us we want lasagna as well? I don't mind paying for a good meal but if the service sucks it just ruins the rest of the experience.

CsJQ_zUN1sEicxrJsMiKKA.text: Amazing. From NYC and have been to the original a few times and the Vegas one was just as good. Saul was a great captain and Keith was a great co pilot. Sort of stole the show he was so funny attentive and sweet. Overall great rxperience and amazing food. Def recommend!

HLkwmrKx8hFzjhhaKDL0Jw.text: Delicious food, but I felt like because I did not order five courses I was an annoyance.  I ran into someone else at the hotel who felt the same way.  Food was amazing and service overall amazing except for this slight pretentiousness.

qzHKdaH6zVM4itIUsPfT4A.text: the is food here is considered good. But service is bad for a place like this.  Wish I could recommend this place to other but for this price I would expect better service.

Zj1gXVAbNr34Zz9l9Ab9eg.text: My husband and I came here during our honeymoon. The servers weren't very friendly and it's confusing because it's a team style service restaurant so you don't have just one server. It was extremely loud in the restaurant, and there was a horribly rowdy party next to us that was screaming and carrying on. We mentioned it to the server and they acted like they couldn't care less. I expect more out of a expensive restaurant.

cAH9094qLlkFZ3og0njX1Q.text: One of the top dining experiences I have ever encountered. Excellent service from the time I walked in to the time we left. We were greeted with extreme professionalism and a smile that continued throughout the meal. The Spicy Rigatoni Vodka and Veal Parmesan were delicious and wine selection was extensive.  There was never a crumb on our table and our glasses, both wine and water, were never empty.   Top notch experience at Carbone's!!! Will definitely be back next time we are in LV!

nRGME_vHeaSgn1zhCEzWiA.text: Overpriced and under delivered.    Where to start?  Perhaps with the fact that the question "flat or sparkling" doesn't include a tap water offering.  Instead, flat water is bottles and bottles of Fiji water straight out of the unscrewed Fiji plastic bottles. . Forget whether the price is worth it, how about not trucking water halfway across the planet in plastic bottles?  Fiji is about as far from Italy as Las Vegas, so it is just pure pretension.  Serving it directly from the plastic bottles is kind of the perfect metaphor for this place.  yeah, I get that you want us to be impressed that you are pouring Fiji water. Just like we can buy at the gas station.  The bread basket is impressive looking but about one notch above Olive Garden.  The minestrone soup (at $20/bowl) is artfully presented but lukewarm and utterly flavorless.  Every single person in our group tried - and panned -  the soup. When I mentioned it to the waiter he said he never recommends the soup.  Thanks for not steering us away from it.    The wine list is impressive, but with the least expensive bottle being in the mid $80 range for wines that retail at mid $30s the markup on the bottles is ridiculous bordering on insulting. No, i take that back. It IS insulting.  Standard markup at restaurant is 200% guys.  Not 300% or more. The cheapest by-the-glass wine is $16 a glass for a bottle that retails for less than $30. Wines are not 300% better just because they are poured here. If you come expecting to order a bottle of wine with dinner plan on spending at least $100 and that doesn't get you many options.       Octopus appetizer is mediocre. The rigatoni was delicious, but I would expect delicious rigatoni at a high-end Italian place. Porterhouse steak was great, but nothing a high-end steakhouse wouldn't serve. The unbelivablly large shrimp were impressive to see, but basically just a grilled shimp. The chicken was probably the most impressive meat - very juicy and tender.  Service was not up to the level of the price.  It's good, don't get me wrong, but not the hover-over-you attentive that I would expect for these prices. A weird mix of 1950s and 1960s music plays a bit too loudly in the background.  Nothing says intimate Italian like "Stand By Me" played about 15 decibels louder than it should have been.   Lemon cello at the end seemed rushed and an afterthought. It was OK, although the alcohol overpowered the lemon.   Wast it bad?  Other than the minestrone soup, no, it was not bad.  It even had elements of great (the rigatoni). Would I go back?  No way.  There are too many other (better) options at this price point.  I'm giving 3 stars simply because it failed to deliver in just about every way. Not in food, not in ambiance, not in services.  We left very disappointed.

nFtIGvRnK25EUSnFmmWXrw.text: I have been dying to go to Carbone in NYC for years so when the opportunity while staying at Aria presented itself there was no question about if we were going.   I was at first a little put off because we sat for a while without any waiter interaction but our lovely waitress promptly came over and apologized for the wait (there was a issue with one of her tables checks)  The rest of the night went flawlessly. The food was amazing and this was probably one of the best meals of my life.   Appetizers: Shrimp Scampi (langostinis were not up to the chefs liking so we got two giant tiger shrimp the size of our hands and they were THE BEST SHRIMP IVE EVER HAD)  Octopus (buttery and sweet, with carmelized onions and peppers so so good)   Spicy Rigatoni ( I have been dreaming about eating this for I kid you not 3 years. It lived up to the hype. The perfect pasta)  Mains: Veal Parm (based on principle I never eat veal but this was a must try. Theres nothing more I can say but GET THIS YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY)    Duck fat fried potatoes , speaks for itself  Thank you for such a wonderful first Carbone experience I cannot wait to be back

91ZJ9ZI6H16-Z8NADhxvVA.text: Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant here in Vegas!   My go to items are:  Lobster ravioli, spicy rigatoni, veal & the octopus!  All pasta noodles are cooked to perfection, amazing texture & flavor. I have never been disappointed for any reasons at this restaurant. From their customer service, to professionalism and speed, just superb!  Will be running on the treadmill everyday til I can return for a meal lol.

URRvNwlq_-BwLjNdCxZcPQ.text: Legit Italian food.  Everything from the bread to the pasta to the veal parmigiana.  Definitely give it a try if you are in the Aria. Great service and even better food.

H3TvYCYC7ZWWe5v9sHGfIA.text: I would give it 6 stars if I could!  If you're someone who truly savors great food - you'll find this restaurant a sumptuous experience!   They bring you lots of little goodies to start (Parmesan, soppressata salami, a variety of breads, marinated cauliflower).     Ordered a glass of nice, rich Barolo wine.  I started with a Gorgonzola Aceto salad - so delicious I kept it to enjoy throughout the meal.    For my entree went with Veal Marsala - unlike any I'd had before...it consisted of a large veal chop with grilled portobello mushrooms and a sauce that was sublime!  Finished off with coffee as I could not imagine eating more - but once again they came with a little finishing treat - 2 little cake-like cookies - I couldn't resist!  I will definitely make this a "must go" meal for all trips to Vegas!

_OFes49mgBd09YWDvGoLRA.text: Great Italian restaurant! We had the spicy rigatoni & angel hair pasta. The spicy rigatoni was excellent & the angel hair pasta was also good. Service was great, dessert amazing & fun atmosphere. Very cozy, warm & friendly restaurant.

2qlDfoQXfV1J1ZLYjnQfDQ.text: Its surprising Carbone has so many 5-star reviews because it is just average. The portions are small and just okay, the service is on the slower side because it tends to be crowded (probably due to the misleading reviews), and its very pricey for the quality and quantity.   The only good thing I would say about this restaurant is the bottle of limoncello at the end. There are far too many superior restaurants in Vegas, find one of those.

8dtgZ4l1qyFgdwEpCwVOcA.text: I was really excited to try Carbone in Vegas, we chose to go there with a client but unfortunately I was disappointing. I have been to Carbone in NY and I was expecting outstanding service which was definitely not the case in the Vegas location. We had to get the servers attention to order wine or get our waters filled, they knocked a glass down and just said "woops!" The food was ok, but considering all the amazing dining options in Vegas, we will be skipping it next time.

F_Qp5LHtecDMAM8Iq1AM1w.text: This place is awesome!! Service , food ,  the whole atmosphere is above 5 stars!! We tried few different things and everything was so good. Their Employees were well chosen . Highly recommend this place!

At0GIh2OL-UeCBWBEi9QzQ.text: Carbone was amazing! The atmosphere was so nice, has that old gangster mob type feeling to it. The portions are not large but the taste is out of this world! Although everything was cooked to perfection their Rigatoni was what stood out the most to me. Make sure you call a head for reservations as this place is pretty popular. I will definitely be eating here again!

yv7djssLdAzbiqTsRWgkhw.text: Amazing Italian Restaurant!! We sat at the bar and Robert took care of us!! He was on point with every recommendation!  We started with the clams, they give you 3 casino, 3 oregano and 3 of something else. All were delicious, flavorful and cooked perfectly. We had the tortellini in bolognese and the veal parm for dinner split between my boyfriend and I. We had plenty of food and it all tasted perfect. The restaurant was very clean and super efficient. I will 100% be back!

qUXCiyN1WIbLz-ViM2mfsQ.text: Great food, but oh my goodness our Captain wasn't a pleasant person. Half the people in my party said the NYC location is better (better service and bigger portions). I highly recommend the lemon cheesecake and a glass of Cortile BDM though!

QmnvwCwfWcJz9Pq1HpZI7g.text: Came here with a party of 5. Cool atmosphere good service and good food. I will say however, we were duped a bit when ordering, the waitress made the impression that the dishes were really small and had us order a few too many dishes. Due to this we initially ordered the veal parmesan which is the only dish we really wanted to try and ended up having to cancel it after our pastas since there was way too much food.   ANTIPASTIs - Octopus Pizzaiolo (5 stars) smokey you can really taste that BBQ charcoal flavor. Delicious  Zuppa E Insalate - House Chopped (4 stars): it's chopped salad how great can it be. Still that being said great salad.   - Caprese (5 stars): very fresh mozzarella. Probably one of the best I've had. Also they cut it up in front of you. Tomoatoes very fresh   Macaroni - Tortellini al Ragu (4 stars): nothing that really blew me away, but good dish. - lobster ravioli (4 stars): pretty good dish but I have had better.  - Spicy Rigatoni Vodka (4.5 stars): very solid spicy rigatoni vodka sauce. Creamy and quite delicious. I would probably order this pasta over any of the others.   Pesci - Pork Chop & peppers (4 stars): good dish but did not wow me. Pork was tender and moist. If I had to do it again probably would not get this dish and substitute it for the veal parmesan we were unable to try. - white fish (fish of the day) (4.5 stars): This was surprisingly a fairly good dish. very light fish.    Contorni - Funghi Trifolati- Good dish. Interesting with all the variety of different mushrooms.  - Truffle corn - You can see all the shavings of truffle on the top of the corn. Good but very overpowering with the abundant truffle shavings.   Overall good place to eat. Atmosphere was great. Oh forgot to mention they give you free limoncello and italian wedding cake. I would probably dine here again for a special occassion.

wT9AZF8WzOxal7tBHtrQgg.text: If you're looking for a tasty and fine dining experience, Carbone is the place to go. Bread and cheese while you wait for your food is amazing.   Main dishes took longer to be served than usual and some dishes like the pastas were overly salty. Ribeye, octopus, raw tuna, meatball, fish, and caprese were excellent. Drinks were pretty and well made, but nothing special.   Service started out great then he ignored us halfway into our dinner and never even came by again. Pretty rude since they didn't seem that busy, but at least there was help to bring us our check.   They seem to try to motivate you to order more than you need, but don't. The plates, though fairly sized, are filling. So just choose what floats your boat.   Don't think I'd go back again, unless the bar area offers the bread basket, which really was the highlight of the dinner for me!

tF6n6ksGgg2QODahiGUXhw.text: Dinner starts with complementary cheese, pepperoni dish  and a basket with three different types of bread. We had the Baked Clams, Spicy Rigatoni and Veal Marsala. The best was the Spicy Rigatoni then Baked Clams and last of my favorites was the Veal Marsala. They finish the night with a house made Liquor and a tiny dessert with the Italian flag. Service was great and very helpful when explaining the menu items.

naeCcnvsGcymxFyqZmnWSA.text: Food and service are excellent.    But the plates are really bad for my appetite. I asked busers why plates are broken. They give me an interesting answer.   Carbone make them feel like home, broken plates are normal at home.   I am like okay, but I don't feel like a home to me. I thought I was experiencing fine dining restaurant.

-0gj64jRWj3OVfep_ICPNw.text: I had a wonderful experience at Carbone the first time I dined there, so I decided to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday at this fine Italian restaurant on our recent trip to Vegas. What I thought would be one of the highlights of our trip ended up being a stain on our vacation. The food was very good - although not as good as my first visit - and the service and ambiance were excellent. It's what happened after our meal that has moved me to write this review.   I paid my bill with my Capital One credit card, and received a notification of the charge on my phone a few minutes after the waiter took my card.  After dinner, we took a tram back to our hotel and about 10 minutes later I received another notification that Carbone had charged me a second time for a slightly higher amount.  I immediately called the restaurant, and after being put on hold to connect to the restaurant, and then again to find a manager, I explained what had happened and the manager (Kevin) I spoke with put me on hold again to look into the matter. Several minutes later, he came back on the line to explain our waiter had 'accidentally' used my card for another bill, but he realized he had made an error and he corrected it. Kevin assured me the second charge - that was wrongly billed to my credit card - would be reversed.  I thanked him and figured mistakes happen, and although my follow up call took close to half an hour of my vacation to sort things out, that would be the end of it. I figured wrong.   A few days later, after I returned home, I received an email from Capital One (kudos to them for their great follow-up) asking me if I meant to leave a tip of $133.20, which was a 73% tip, on a recent visit to Carbone restaurant.  Of course, this tip was charged on top of the bill I was erroneously charged for, which I had been assured would be reversed (the incorrect charge for the wrong bill and large tip came to $316!). I called Capital One and they told me that the second charge had NOT been reversed, but told me that they would investigate and that I would not be charged unless the investigation showed there had been two charges I authorized, which they were confident did not happen (if course, it didn't).   I then called the Aria hotel (where the restaurant is located) and the operator tried to transfer me to the restaurant, but no one answered. It was around noon, and the receptionist explained the restaurant didn't open until 5, but I've worked in that industry and know that just because the restaurant wasn't open didn't mean there wasn't staff working at that time. I explained my situation to the receptionist, who was very empathetic and suggested the hotel's AP dept. might be able to help me. After waiting on hold for a good five minutes I was finally transferred to an AP rep who asked me to hold while he investigated my complaint after I explained what transpired. After several more minutes of hold time he came  back on the line and told me he found the two charges to my Visa, and that he would be looking into the issue, promising a return call within the next 24 hours.  That was several days ago and I have yet to receive that promised call. Fortunately, I have faith in Capital One to sort things out - confidence I surely do not have for Carbone restaurant or the Aria AP dept. I don't think I'll be dining at any of Aria's restaurants again after this experience.   What started out as a nice birthday dinner turned into a series of frustrating experiences, including over an hour wasted on sorting things out through phone calls to Carbone's, Capital One and the Aria hotel.  Mistakes can happen, but this (not comedic) series of errors from a highly regarded restaurant and hotel is unacceptable. If you do choose to dine at Carbone's, make sure you check your credit card bill after you've paid.

kzny27asSosCFo3tsmIQ-A.text: Wow, this was an amazing experience!  The ambiance inside is classy, warm, and comfortable.  We were seated right away at our reservation time.  It did take a little time before anyone came and offered to take drink orders, and it was somewhat confusing since they seemed to have different staff with different roles attending to each table.  Complimentary Reggiano cheese is provided at the table along with a generous and delicious bread basket with three types of bread.  They also provided what appeared to be pepperoni (the staff didn't explain what it was) delicately arranged into cones.    I tried the Mai Tai - they definitely do not skimp on the alcohol with this.  Very good!  We then tried the shrimp cocktail and Caesar salad.  The shrimp were large, fresh, and delicious.  The salad was prepared the "old-fashioned way" tableside in a wooden bowl.  What a nice touch!  We haven't had that even at high-end steak houses on the strip.  I went for the ribeye diana.  It was quite good with fairly tender meat in a flavorful sauce.  Side dishes are a la carte as is typical in a place like this.  The potatoes louie were excellent (crispy roasted potatoes) as was the brocollini with spicy pepper flakes.  Save room for dessert!  I tried the bananas foster served flaming tableside.  Excellent!  A perfect ending to the meal.  Not too sweet and just delicious.    Lastly, they brought out some small complimentary and delicious Italian cookies as well as limoncello.  They left the limoncello bottle... I'm not sure if that's always the case here, but it seemed we were free to have as many servings as we wanted.  It was good - light and lemony though lacked a bit of the creamy consistency I was used to from a limoncello.  Service was generally good though as mentioned above there are so many different staff coming to the table with different functions.  I think we only saw our "table captain" two times during the meal.    Overall, though, this was a wonderful dining experience well worth the price and definitely warrants a return visit.

rUiutbodRh8aamVxWCtECA.text: Carbone in Aria has got to be one of the sexiest, warmest, and most intimate restaurants on the strip. The price tag is not for the faint-hearted, but you'll walk away dazzled if you find value in a beautiful overall experience.  The bar is casual yet glamorous. Beautiful plants and accents of brass, turquoise, and green. The rest of the restaurant is warm and welcoming, adorned with high-backed red booths in curtained spaces and floor-to-ceiling chandeliers that luminate with just the right amount of warmth and romance.  For starters, a bread basket with a few options like sundried tomato  foccacia, salami, and cheese. These were a really nice touch to round out an experience since people like to feel special and not nickel-and-dimed.  First, let's just get it out there that a meal for two here is not cheap. You could move this food quality over to a dodgy space downtown and end up paying less than half of Carbone's price, easily. So I'd say you'd have to be in it for the entire experience, especially if you are trying to celebrate a special occasion or do some romancing.  The tartare was super thin and seasoned so beautifully. Very rich in flavor. Take your time to enjoy it as it goes quickly!   We got a pasta and also the veal shank. I'd probably recommend something else besides the shank because it was so rich, and you couldn't eat much of it. We shared it and still took half of it home.  Dessert.... carrot cake was excellent! We wanted the tiramisu until we found out it was Nutella tiramisu. Probably the one thing that could crush your emotional high at Carbone... wanting to end with a classic, PERFECT tiramisu, and being told you can have Nutella tiramisu. (Please, higher powers at Carbone, if you are reading this... REGULAR tiramisu, and I'll come back!)  Bonus freebie... nice limoncello shots with some Italian almond cookies.   I'd describe Carbone as a special occasion type of place, but if you're looking for value for dollar in terms of food, maybe check somewhere else out. If you're looking for that overall vibe, save your quarters dutifully for a rainy day at Carbone.

H8LDfaNOgm_eDs5jmXSnpw.text: I would like to start by saying our waitress, Bonnie, was amazing! She did a great job explaining the menu, how much to order for three people and she was super sweet! The whole staff was attentive. Kevin, the manager was also great!  The meal started with bread, sliced meat and cheese brought to the table. My friend tried some wine and ended up loving the glass she ordered. We ordered lobster ravioli, eggplant parmigiana, spicy rigatoni and a mozzarella/tomato appetizer. The mozzarella is house made and delicious!! They only have this option for a couple months when tomatoes are in season and perfect. I can't even explain how amazing their mozzarella is!  They only make a certain amount of eggplant parmigiana each day and we were lucky enough to get the last one. Bonnie mentioned that you can order chicken parmigiana two days in advance. Next time I will be sure to mention that when I make a reservation. I love chicken parmigiana and really wanted to try it!  We didn't get a chance to try dessert because we had a show to catch but the dessert tray looked delicious as we rushed by.   They have different rooms in the restaurant. We were in the main dining area that had a lot of red and gold, which gave it a vintage Vegas feel. My favorite!

Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States

njVR2zGterniIGj59bDHIQ.text: I was pretty excited to see there was a Carbone in Vegas since I'd sort of had my heart set on trying them in New York but that opportunity ended up not happening, so... ended up saying f it! While in Vegas, right?  With that being said, I know how things go in Vegas - you open a spot that's from elsewhere and it never ever ever taste like the original. In this case, I guess it's a damn good thing I've never been to the original so I have nothing to compare this to.  I was several, I mean several cocktails deep upon my arrival for dinner so ordering wine or even a cocktail was a no go for me. I really just needed carbs for some absorption and that's what I got.  I knew I was going to order the spicy rigatoni and told myself how much different could this possibly be from the original location other than the water they are boiling the noodles in but you know, I don't know. It was quite tasty and hit the spot.  Great experience here, although on the pricier side I can see myself spending this for a meal at their original location but not completely certain I'd return to spend it for another experience here. Don't mark my words though, it was really quite yummy. The meatballs were also good, but I make some seriously insane great meatballs and I could make probably 3 dozen for the price of 3 here so where they were worth trying I probably don't need them again.  All in all great spot, to heal my heart just a little bit from not visiting their original location but still making it possible for me to try them nonetheless, just in a different city.

ilWRSPYKVIQ5oTnninIyag.text: Wow. Carbone definitely lives up to its hype. Service. Good. Everything. We made reservations a few weeks in advance for Carbone and I was definitely looking forward to it.   We were seated right away and the waiter gave us a few recommendations. We ended up ordering all of his recs.   + Bread Basket - the garlic bread was my favorite. This was so good and the pizza focaccia was so good.   + Caprese Salad - 10/10 - they only serve this for about 9 weeks during the summer. They get tomatoes from Napa and serve it then. It was fresh, seasoned well and everything you'd want it to be.   + Spicy Vodka Rigatoni - 10/10 - the pasta is cooked perfectly al dente and has the perfect amount of spice. So good.   + Veal Parmesan - 10/10 - another dish done perfectly. I've never had veal parm before and I don't think I can have it anymore after having it here.   My only complaint is that they don't have one in LA. Our server was amazing and so nice. I will be back next time I'm in Vegas... which should hopefully be soon because it's only been a day and I already want to go back.

bG2k5x2hvxOnLFlLnZYtgA.text: This place is FANTASTIC! I've heard about this place so many times, but thought it was all hype. One day we were at a random wine bar and this gentleman next to us told us we HAD to try Carbone as it's his favorite. He also told us to sit with Bernie, the best bartender around. Well, we did exactly that! Waited 45 mins to sit at the bar with Bernie and it was the best decision we made all summer!  We ordered: x Beef carpaccio - Wow, this was the best beef carpaccio I've ever had in my life. It was so soft, flavorful and rich. The portion is HUGE enough to share w/ 3-4 people as an appetizer. x Spicy Rigatoni - Bernie suggested we order a side of meatballs w/ this and it was the perfect recommendation. Pasta was perfectly cooked. Meatball was one of the best I ever had! x Caesar Salad - TABLE SIDE YA'LL!! With real anchovies. The best ever!!!   Every table gets pieces of parmesan cheese, a bread basket, and pickled cauliflower as well. All of which, were amazing. I can't wait to come back!! SOOO GOOOD. If you aren't feeling like pasta, just order everything else :)

tkqQpGSpcNf5lCv6CMvWcA.text: WOOOOOW!!! I am seriously blown away by this place! I loved everything. From the ambiance/vibe, to the old school music, which turns into gangster rap at 11pm, but most importantly the quality of the ingredients. Hands down one of the best meals I've ever had on the strip.   I loved that they give complimentary Parmesan cheese as soon as we are sat. The bread basket comes out piping hot. Huge points for that! If you're a fatty like me you'll take a piece of bread, butter it, stick some cheese and salami on it and it's magic in your mouth. The pickled cauliflower was surprisingly very yummy and the perfect relief before starting on our appetizers.   We ordered the Caesar salad (because they make it table side and it's just a must), the chopped salad, and caprese to start. Caesar salad was  AH-MAZING! But I have to say the chopped salad was 10x better and super refreshing. The caprese was probably the best caprese I've ever had. The tomatoes were so sweet, they tasted like they were picked right at their peak and cut then served to us.   For our main dishes we got the Spicy Rigatoni, Dover Sole, Steak, and Veal. It was all phenomenal!   As far as desserts go, we got the lemon cheesecake and that first bite I took I felt like I died and went to heaven.   Carbone you seriously hit it straight out of the ballpark. The best service, experience, and food ever!

-IFwnipFITgMpcbl9wCo5g.text: Gave 3 stars only because after a tough beginning our server/bartender Jason made up for it. Walked in and saw a spot at the bar so I sat down and my husband stood by me, immediately one of the bartenders came to me and said "you can't sit here it's reserved that is why there is a place setting there!" He said it so rudely I was so embarrassed and wanted to run out of there but my husband found another spot at the other end of the bar so I sat there and he stood. We ordered the spicy rigatoni and meatballs and a salad it is overpriced but delicious. This is my third time here and probably won't come back because of the stuffy staff (except for Jason)  If you're at Aria stick to Javier's or Catch much friendlier employees

hXxIIvgX0fj8kNSiG3gK2Q.text: The restaurant itself is beautiful and the ambiance inside is amazing.  The service on the other hand was somewhat lacking. We came in with a party of 12 for my 30th birthday 10 minutes before our reservation and were sat 45 minutes later. During dinner we were checked in on only 1 time. During our ordering process we were being completely rushed. We felt like we weren't important even with dropping a $1,500 bill. I guess that's what happens when you have customers like Tiesto and Steph Curry eating at the same time as you.   All I wanted for my birthday was the SPICY RIGATONI. I was waiting for something outstanding for the 4 +$60 full orders we ordered.. What we got was subpar. The pasta was dry with minimal sauce. The flavor was ok, it seemed like it has been sitting a while. We also ordered the branzino, which we never got. The chef took it upon himself to switch out the branzino for two smaller fish, one of which had a super sour taste. It would have been nice if they asked us what we wanted instead of taking it upon themselves to serve us another fish entirely.  On a positive note, the Madagascar shrimp, prosciutto, and Caesar salad were phenomenal.  I could have overlooked some of the negatives had out experience been better.  If you want that amazing dinning and food experience I would go somewhere else. I was disappointed and this place is definitely not worth the hype.

z6-0EIsjMxljklsgUzPMZg.text: Small portions  and extremely overpriced Italian food Somalier never came back to our table after we ordered an inexpensive bottle of white  Could not get a bucket with ice asked twice We got a second bottle of red from our waiter since the som disappeared   Desserts big disappointment. They need a real pastry chef for the prices they charge

BYZcKjqF3EgZT6ruXh3gVw.text: I love this place. The pasta here is always so good! And they give you free cheese tooo..

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cxVixEytDkUAjrcwlXkxRQ.text: Food not quite as good as service but excellent.  Pace meal for our large party perfect. Staff of elevated energy and quite helpful for ordering.  Definitely a perfect spot for biz type entertainment.  Order the veal marsalla or sea bass...both perfect!

XG-fKxW64UfBifs75TI-RQ.text: Damn. It's honestly a 3.5 star experience.  I'm rounding up because the service really was that damn good. I have so many thoughts about this place, so if this review gets all over the place my apologies.   Backstory : Wife and I in Vegas for a 2 nighter no kids. Been wanting to try this spot. Had about 250 dollars worth of mlife points from my mlife credit card that I converted to express comps to use here. So yes it was going to be a free or almost free meal. I know Carbone is expensive and this is Vegas so I didn't think I was able to be surprised by prices. I was wrong.  Atmosphere: Carbone is absolutely stunning. It just looks so crisp and impressive.  We had a great booth in the main dining room.  My wife and I ordered a bunch of stuff and shared it family style. I think it's the best way to do Carbone. Here's what we got.  Shrimp Cocktail: Honestly not impressed.  The cocktail sauce was not good. And  it was 34 dollars! For a shrimp cocktail! Crazy and not good.  Caesar alla Zz: Salad was made tableside.  They split it for us. It was good not great. I love tableside Caesar. If any restaurant has it I'll automatically order it. It just didn't blow mind. Note :Salad is huge. Don't order one salad per person. $24   Spicy Rigatoni: Excellent.  The signature dish. My wife has celiac and they split this for us giving her gluten free pasta and me regular. Good job Carbone. Way to be on it.  Ribeye Diana: Really good. Perfectly cooked as requested  at medium rare.  Sides:  Roasted Potato : Meh.  Corn: Wow! So good.  Drinks:  Lemon Drop: 24 dollars. Geez come on  This is where Vegas just gets stupid to me   24 bucks for just a standard  Lemon Drop? Old Fashioned: A bargain compared to my wifes Lemon Drop at an 18 dollar price tag. This drink was really good. I was taken aback when I read on the drink menu that Carbone's signature Old Fashioned is made with Rum. I had never heard of that. I tried to order with Whiskey but our Captain Assistant talked me in to trying it the way make it. His service was top knotch all night. He told me he's an old fashioned guy and he totally digs the rum Carbone version.  Glad I trusted him. He was on the money. Drink was amazing.  Service: First class all the way. We had our main captain and then the assistant helping us. They know how to take care of you here.  Gluten: My wife can't have it. The captain was super knowledgeable about which items were gluten free, which could be modified, and which ones were a no go. Almost the whole menu is gluten free or can be modified to be gluten free.  FinalThoughts: Glad I tried it but I don't think I'll be back. Service was great and the food overall was good but for what you would pay here I feel like there's better options.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Fashioned. With Rum. Try it.

LzUUPu9n3nvxYSxBtJIvcg.text: CARBONE. Just the name takes me back to one of the most memorable dinners I've had in recent history. Although the one in NY has been on my bucket list for ages, was thrilled to check out the one in Vegas, conveniently timed with my birthday. Couldn't have been a more perfect choice for my dinner. I knew I wanted Italian, but with all the great food on the Strip it was tough to land on a choice, though I knew deep down Carbone had always been it. And I was not disappointed.  It's borderline indescribable what makes the ambiance so spot-on and enticing. You walk in and see a photo of Christopher Walken flanking the wall behind the host stand. You're immediately engulfed in something that exudes a masculine vibe with touches of mafioso glamour, but elegant enough for us ladies to be dressed to the 9's and feel on top of the world. But not so elegant that it feels stuffy.  The servers are friendly/accessible, not snooty at all. The menu is tight but you really don't need to overthink at all. We opted for the Caesar salad ("Caesar alla ZZ" to be exact) we had heard so much about + 2 pastas and it was the perfect amount. The presentation element on the Caesar salad was something else (a show in and of itself). I'd also say that it was probably the best rendition I have had in my life.  But before the dishes even came out, we had a delicious bread basket brought to the table (who would have thought a bread basket could be this exciting?). After the salad, we moved on to the pasta, and here's where my mouth starts watering even now. The Spicy Rigatoni Vodka is well worth the hype. It's perfectly cooked, and clearly one of their signature dishes. Our other dish of Fettuccine Con Funghi was a fragrant, wonderful complement.  For dessert, of course I wanted the flair that came with the Bananas Foster and that it did deliver, along with an oh so delicious version of something I have always loved. This was paired with complimentary limoncello, such a nice touch.  The entire staff is cooperative with supporting each table and like I mentioned, not stuffy at all. I expected an air of attitude at some point given this place truly is $$$$, but not once did I pick up on it. I did notice the dichotomy of truly delicious wine in perfectly-polished glasses with plates that came with chips on the edges. We began wondering if this was intentional only after several plates came in that way. Guess we'll chalk it up to the 'charm' that's part of the establishment?  Overall excellent experience though. Would recommend for die hard Italian-lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster dessert, created at the table
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine con Funghi $28, Spicy Rigatoni Vodka $28
Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu of delights

cg0jfO7acA3C-ZA-VuJ81g.text: If you are looking to splurge, Carbone is theee place. The ambiance is traditional upscale Italian. The cocktail menu ranges from wine to a list of Rum. As for dinner options, There are menu options that may throw you off, however it is family style. The Carpaccio is absolutely delish. I suggest ordering a app, share pasta plate with an entre. If you over order you may not have room for dessert. As an end to a fantastic dinner, you will finish off with home made lemonchello.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemoncchello

LPiyzSK9Rs0XkKmRIq34aw.text: It's really disappointing to be giving 3 stars considering this is one of my favorite places to eat on the strip. The past couple times we have dined the severs are WAY too pushy. I'm a local I know what I want I have my favorites I do not need to be pressured to order anything else after multiple times of the server coming and saying "that's all you want" "are you sure you don't want to order more?" Uh yes I am sure I'm pretty sure I would let the server know if I wanted to order more. It is super unprofessional of the servers to approach customers this way. Not sure if management is pushing them to have a higher check average. Either way it doesn't matter stop making customers feel uncomfortable. From this point on I'll only dine at the bar with the bartenders they are relaxed and NOT PUSHY.

to6FH_WpNgnNL-JIM_d6-A.text: There are some meals you want to forget, some meals you do forget, and some meals you cannot forget.  This was one we will never forget.  For our 10th anniversary, we wanted to go some place special and Carbone's came highly recommended.  The ambiance of the restaurant alone was worth going.  It gave us that classic-Vegas feel.  The music was perfect for the restaurant.  They played many classic tunes and it set the mood perfectly.    Our waiter, Dion, was one of the best waiters we've ever had.  He was professional, courteous, and personable.  But mostly, he didn't come off as a snooty waiter that you sometimes get at restaurants of this caliber.  He was relatable and treated us with respect and courtesy.  Helping Dion was Richard, who also treated us like royalty and made us feel valued as customers.    The food was some of the best I've ever had.  The bread service was top notch and I cannot get over how good the fresh Parmesan was.  For our appetizers, we had the sizzling pancetta (phenomenal) and the beef carpaccio (yum!)The meal itself is almost indescribably good.  We shared a spicy rigatoni and porterhouse with a side of potatoes Louie.  We also had two of the meatballs.  Best potatoes I have ever had in my life.  They were so delicious that I literally (and I hate using that word because so many people use it incorrectly) was at a loss for words.  It was an absolutely remarkable side.  Unless you don't like potatoes, get these at all costs.  The steak was also delicious and one of the best I've had.  The rigatoni was  good and definitely spicy!  For dessert we ordered the carrot cake and it became the best carrot cake we've ever had.    I've read some reviews on here regarding the size of the portions.  It is True, they are smaller than other places, but here is the thing:  This isn't the Olive Garden or Fazoli's.  You don't get your meal served with a shovel or in a trough.  This is fine dining with exquisite cooking, and is meant to be served in a certain way.  We followed Dion's advice and ordered the multi-course meal and had more than enough food.  We even ended up taking some with us.  You also won't find Olive Garden's prices here, so be prepared.   But it was worth every single penny we spent.    Good memories have no price tag, and this was one of those good memories.  When we are old and gray, we are going to remember the night we went to Carbone's.

photos.caption: Photo of Carbone - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room.  Weird photo, but only one I took for some reason.

NwlpQdvK7DyPyHEXLdAHIQ.text: Probably still a 4 star but just having such high expectation and everything was just not that life changing like everyone else raved about.  As Carbone NY is just impossible go make reservation, decided to try the one in LV and call it a day.   Prosciutto & Mozzarella - good but so does everywhere else.  Baked Clam - it's fine, when there's too many layers it's hard to know what you are eating.  Caesar Salad - I thought they said it's homemade dressing but really couldn't tell the difference. It's a good Caesar Salad, but not a unique one you have to have at $25,  anchovy was also way too salty to eat.  Meatball - secret menu, not bad but also nothing special, tomato sauce was good though.  Rigatoni Vodka - so excited to have my first bite and then I didn't bother to maybe have the third one. Over-sauced, etc..  Dover Sole - it's a okay fish but not worth $125...  Squash with Ricotta or Mascarpone side - very fatty dish but love it the flavor was great.   Not to be the only person not loving Carbone here, everything was done "fine" here, but just no excitement and lack of satisfaction after having the meal. I know LV is expensive but Carbone also it's super on the top of the LV expensive side.   Also our reservation was 8pm, and we got there around 7:40pm. Host goes: if your reservation is at 8pm means you will get seated at 8pm, not earlier. He suggest we go grab a drink at the bar, we were at the bar until 8:15pm and no one ever come take us to our table until we go back to the entry and remind them, not very hospitality.
